Table frpm column names: CDSCode, Academic Year, County Code, District Code, School Code , County Name, District Name , School Name, District Type, School Type , Educational Option Type, NSLP Provision Status, Charter School (Y/N), Charter School Number, Charter Funding Type, IRC, Low Grade, High Grade, Enrollment (K-12), Free Meal Count (K-12), Percent (%) Eligible Free (K-12), FRPM Count (K-12), Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (K-12), Enrollment (Ages 5-17), Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17),  Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17), FRPM Count (Ages 5-17), Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (Ages 5-17), 2013-14 CALPADS Fall 1 Certification Status
Table satscores column names: cds, rtype, sname, dname, cname, enroll12, NumTstTakr, AvgScrRead, AvgScrMath, AvgScrWrite, NumGE1500
Table schools column names: CDSCode, NCESDist, NCESSchool, StatusType, County, District, School, Street, StreetAbr, City, Zip, State, MailStreet, MailStrAbr, MailCity, MailZip, MailState, Phone, Ext, Website, OpenDate, ClosedDate, Charter, CharterNum, FundingType, DOC, DOCType, SOC, SOCType, EdOpsCode, EdOpsName, EILCode, EILName, GSoffered, GSserved, Virtual, Magnet, Latitude, Longitude, AdmFName1, AdmLName1, AdmEmail1, AdmFName2, AdmLName2, AdmEmail2, AdmFName3, AdmLName3, AdmEmail3, LastUpdate
chosen:
SELECT
  `T1`.`School Name`,
  `T2`.`Street`,
  `T2`.`City`,
  `T2`.`State`,
  `T2`.`Zip`
FROM `frpm` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `schools` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`CDSCode` = `T2`.`CDSCode`
WHERE
  `T2`.`County` = 'Monterey'
  AND `T1`.`Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)` > 800
  AND `T1`.`School Type` = 'High Schools (Public)'
rejected:
SELECT
  `T2`.`School`,
  `T2`.`Street`,
  `T2`.`City`,
  `T2`.`State`,
  `T2`.`Zip`
FROM `frpm` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `schools` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`CDSCode` = `T2`.`CDSCode`
WHERE
  `T2`.`County` = 'Monterey' AND `T2`.`StatusType` = 'High School' AND `T1`.`FRPM Count (Ages 5-17)` > 800

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
What is the average score in writing for the schools that were opened after 1991 or closed before 2000? List the school names along with the score. Also, list the communication number of the schools if there is any.
Table frpm column names: CDSCode, Academic Year, County Code, District Code, School Code , County Name, District Name , School Name, District Type, School Type , Educational Option Type, NSLP Provision Status, Charter School (Y/N), Charter School Number, Charter Funding Type, IRC, Low Grade, High Grade, Enrollment (K-12), Free Meal Count (K-12), Percent (%) Eligible Free (K-12), FRPM Count (K-12), Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (K-12), Enrollment (Ages 5-17), Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17),  Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17), FRPM Count (Ages 5-17), Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (Ages 5-17), 2013-14 CALPADS Fall 1 Certification Status
Table satscores column names: cds, rtype, sname, dname, cname, enroll12, NumTstTakr, AvgScrRead, AvgScrMath, AvgScrWrite, NumGE1500
Table schools column names: CDSCode, NCESDist, NCESSchool, StatusType, County, District, School, Street, StreetAbr, City, Zip, State, MailStreet, MailStrAbr, MailCity, MailZip, MailState, Phone, Ext, Website, OpenDate, ClosedDate, Charter, CharterNum, FundingType, DOC, DOCType, SOC, SOCType, EdOpsCode, EdOpsName, EILCode, EILName, GSoffered, GSserved, Virtual, Magnet, Latitude, Longitude, AdmFName1, AdmLName1, AdmEmail1, AdmFName2, AdmLName2, AdmEmail2, AdmFName3, AdmLName3, AdmEmail3, LastUpdate
chosen:
SELECT
  `T2`.`School`,
  `T1`.`AvgScrWrite`,
  `T2`.`Phone`
FROM `schools` AS `T2`
LEFT JOIN `satscores` AS `T1`
  ON `T2`.`CDSCode` = `T1`.`cds`
WHERE
  DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T2`.`OpenDate` AS DATETIME), '%Y') > '1991'
  OR DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T2`.`ClosedDate` AS DATETIME), '%Y') < '2000'
rejected:

  `T2`.`School`,
  `T1`.`AvgScrWrite`,
  `T2`.`Phone`
FROM `satscores` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `schools` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`cds` = `T2`.`CDSCode`
WHERE
  DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T2`.`OpenDate` AS DATETIME), '%Y') > '1991'
  OR DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T2`.`ClosedDate` AS DATETIME), '%Y') < '2000'

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
Consider the average difference between K-12 enrollment and 15-17 enrollment of schools that are locally funded, list the names and DOC type of schools which has a difference above this average.
Table frpm column names: CDSCode, Academic Year, County Code, District Code, School Code , County Name, District Name , School Name, District Type, School Type , Educational Option Type, NSLP Provision Status, Charter School (Y/N), Charter School Number, Charter Funding Type, IRC, Low Grade, High Grade, Enrollment (K-12), Free Meal Count (K-12), Percent (%) Eligible Free (K-12), FRPM Count (K-12), Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (K-12), Enrollment (Ages 5-17), Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17),  Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17), FRPM Count (Ages 5-17), Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (Ages 5-17), 2013-14 CALPADS Fall 1 Certification Status
Table satscores column names: cds, rtype, sname, dname, cname, enroll12, NumTstTakr, AvgScrRead, AvgScrMath, AvgScrWrite, NumGE1500
Table schools column names: CDSCode, NCESDist, NCESSchool, StatusType, County, District, School, Street, StreetAbr, City, Zip, State, MailStreet, MailStrAbr, MailCity, MailZip, MailState, Phone, Ext, Website, OpenDate, ClosedDate, Charter, CharterNum, FundingType, DOC, DOCType, SOC, SOCType, EdOpsCode, EdOpsName, EILCode, EILName, GSoffered, GSserved, Virtual, Magnet, Latitude, Longitude, AdmFName1, AdmLName1, AdmEmail1, AdmFName2, AdmLName2, AdmEmail2, AdmFName3, AdmLName3, AdmEmail3, LastUpdate
chosen:
SELECT
  `T2`.`School`,
  `T2`.`DOC`
FROM `frpm` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `schools` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`CDSCode` = `T2`.`CDSCode`
WHERE
  `T2`.`FundingType` = 'Locally funded'
  AND (
    `T1`.`Enrollment (K-12)` - `T1`.`Enrollment (Ages 5-17)`
  ) > (
    SELECT
      AVG(`T3`.`Enrollment (K-12)` - `T3`.`Enrollment (Ages 5-17)`)
    FROM `frpm` AS `T3`
    INNER JOIN `schools` AS `T4`
      ON `T3`.`CDSCode` = `T4`.`CDSCode`
    WHERE
      `T4`.`FundingType` = 'Locally funded'
  )
rejected:
SELECT
  `T2`.`School`,
  `T2`.`DOCType`
FROM (
  SELECT
    AVG(`T1`.`Enrollment (K-12)` - `T1`.`Enrollment (Ages 5-17)`) AS `avg_diff`
  FROM `frpm` AS `T1`
  WHERE
    `T1`.`Charter School (Y/N)` = 'N'
) AS `T3`
INNER JOIN `frpm` AS `T1`
  ON `T1`.`Charter School (Y/N)` = 'N'
INNER JOIN `schools` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`CDSCode` = `T1`.`CDSCode`
WHERE
  `T1`.`Enrollment (K-12)` - `T1`.`Enrollment (Ages 5-17)` > `T3`.`avg_diff`

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
What is the eligible free rate of the 10th and 11th schools with the highest enrolment for students in grades 1 through 12?
Table frpm column names: CDSCode, Academic Year, County Code, District Code, School Code , County Name, District Name , School Name, District Type, School Type , Educational Option Type, NSLP Provision Status, Charter School (Y/N), Charter School Number, Charter Funding Type, IRC, Low Grade, High Grade, Enrollment (K-12), Free Meal Count (K-12), Percent (%) Eligible Free (K-12), FRPM Count (K-12), Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (K-12), Enrollment (Ages 5-17), Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17),  Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17), FRPM Count (Ages 5-17), Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (Ages 5-17), 2013-14 CALPADS Fall 1 Certification Status
Table satscores column names: cds, rtype, sname, dname, cname, enroll12, NumTstTakr, AvgScrRead, AvgScrMath, AvgScrWrite, NumGE1500
Table schools column names: CDSCode, NCESDist, NCESSchool, StatusType, County, District, School, Street, StreetAbr, City, Zip, State, MailStreet, MailStrAbr, MailCity, MailZip, MailState, Phone, Ext, Website, OpenDate, ClosedDate, Charter, CharterNum, FundingType, DOC, DOCType, SOC, SOCType, EdOpsCode, EdOpsName, EILCode, EILName, GSoffered, GSserved, Virtual, Magnet, Latitude, Longitude, AdmFName1, AdmLName1, AdmEmail1, AdmFName2, AdmLName2, AdmEmail2, AdmFName3, AdmLName3, AdmEmail3, LastUpdate
chosen:
SELECT
  CAST(`Free Meal Count (K-12)` AS DOUBLE) / `Enrollment (K-12)`
FROM `frpm`
ORDER BY
  `Enrollment (K-12)` DESC
LIMIT 2
OFFSET 9
rejected:

  `Free Meal Count (K-12)` / `Enrollment (K-12)`
FROM `frpm`
ORDER BY
  `Enrollment (K-12)` DESC
LIMIT 2 OFFSET 9

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
What is the eligible free or reduced price meal rate for the top 5 schools in grades 1-12 with the highest free or reduced price meal count of the schools with the ownership code 66?
Table frpm column names: CDSCode, Academic Year, County Code, District Code, School Code , County Name, District Name , School Name, District Type, School Type , Educational Option Type, NSLP Provision Status, Charter School (Y/N), Charter School Number, Charter Funding Type, IRC, Low Grade, High Grade, Enrollment (K-12), Free Meal Count (K-12), Percent (%) Eligible Free (K-12), FRPM Count (K-12), Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (K-12), Enrollment (Ages 5-17), Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17),  Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17), FRPM Count (Ages 5-17), Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (Ages 5-17), 2013-14 CALPADS Fall 1 Certification Status
Table satscores column names: cds, rtype, sname, dname, cname, enroll12, NumTstTakr, AvgScrRead, AvgScrMath, AvgScrWrite, NumGE1500
Table schools column names: CDSCode, NCESDist, NCESSchool, StatusType, County, District, School, Street, StreetAbr, City, Zip, State, MailStreet, MailStrAbr, MailCity, MailZip, MailState, Phone, Ext, Website, OpenDate, ClosedDate, Charter, CharterNum, FundingType, DOC, DOCType, SOC, SOCType, EdOpsCode, EdOpsName, EILCode, EILName, GSoffered, GSserved, Virtual, Magnet, Latitude, Longitude, AdmFName1, AdmLName1, AdmEmail1, AdmFName2, AdmLName2, AdmEmail2, AdmFName3, AdmLName3, AdmEmail3, LastUpdate
chosen:
SELECT
  CAST(`T1`.`FRPM Count (K-12)` AS DOUBLE) / `T1`.`Enrollment (K-12)`
FROM `frpm` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `schools` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`CDSCode` = `T2`.`CDSCode`
WHERE
  `T2`.`SOC` = 66
ORDER BY
  `T1`.`FRPM Count (K-12)` DESC
LIMIT 5
rejected:
SELECT
  `T1`.`Free Meal Count (K-12)` / `T1`.`Enrollment (K-12)`
FROM `frpm` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `schools` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`CDSCode` = `T2`.`CDSCode`
WHERE
  `T2`.`DOC` = 66 AND `T2`.`GSserved` LIKE '%1-12%'
ORDER BY
  `T1`.`FRPM Count (K-12)` DESC
LIMIT 5

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
What is the average number of test takers from Fresno schools that opened between 1/1/1980 and 12/31/1980?
Table frpm column names: CDSCode, Academic Year, County Code, District Code, School Code , County Name, District Name , School Name, District Type, School Type , Educational Option Type, NSLP Provision Status, Charter School (Y/N), Charter School Number, Charter Funding Type, IRC, Low Grade, High Grade, Enrollment (K-12), Free Meal Count (K-12), Percent (%) Eligible Free (K-12), FRPM Count (K-12), Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (K-12), Enrollment (Ages 5-17), Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17),  Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17), FRPM Count (Ages 5-17), Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (Ages 5-17), 2013-14 CALPADS Fall 1 Certification Status
Table satscores column names: cds, rtype, sname, dname, cname, enroll12, NumTstTakr, AvgScrRead, AvgScrMath, AvgScrWrite, NumGE1500
Table schools column names: CDSCode, NCESDist, NCESSchool, StatusType, County, District, School, Street, StreetAbr, City, Zip, State, MailStreet, MailStrAbr, MailCity, MailZip, MailState, Phone, Ext, Website, OpenDate, ClosedDate, Charter, CharterNum, FundingType, DOC, DOCType, SOC, SOCType, EdOpsCode, EdOpsName, EILCode, EILName, GSoffered, GSserved, Virtual, Magnet, Latitude, Longitude, AdmFName1, AdmLName1, AdmEmail1, AdmFName2, AdmLName2, AdmEmail2, AdmFName3, AdmLName3, AdmEmail3, LastUpdate
chosen:
SELECT
  AVG(`T1`.`NumTstTakr`)
FROM `satscores` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `schools` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`cds` = `T2`.`CDSCode`
WHERE
  DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T2`.`OpenDate` AS DATETIME), '%Y') = '1980'
  AND `T2`.`County` = 'Fresno'
rejected:
SELECT
  AVG(`T2`.`NumTstTakr`)
FROM `schools` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `satscores` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`CDSCode` = `T2`.`cds`
WHERE
  DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T1`.`OpenDate` AS DATETIME), '%Y-%m-%d') BETWEEN '1980-01-01' AND '1980-12-31'
  AND `T1`.`County` = 'Fresno'

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:

Table satscores column names: cds, rtype, sname, dname, cname, enroll12, NumTstTakr, AvgScrRead, AvgScrMath, AvgScrWrite, NumGE1500

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
List the names of virtual schools that are among the top 5 in their respective counties based on average reading scores.
Table frpm column names: CDSCode, Academic Year, County Code, District Code, School Code , County Name, District Name , School Name, District Type, School Type , Educational Option Type, NSLP Provision Status, Charter School (Y/N), Charter School Number, Charter Funding Type, IRC, Low Grade, High Grade, Enrollment (K-12), Free Meal Count (K-12), Percent (%) Eligible Free (K-12), FRPM Count (K-12), Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (K-12), Enrollment (Ages 5-17), Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17),  Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17), FRPM Count (Ages 5-17), Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (Ages 5-17), 2013-14 CALPADS Fall 1 Certification Status
Table satscores column names: cds, rtype, sname, dname, cname, enroll12, NumTstTakr, AvgScrRead, AvgScrMath, AvgScrWrite, NumGE1500
Table schools column names: CDSCode, NCESDist, NCESSchool, StatusType, County, District, School, Street, StreetAbr, City, Zip, State, MailStreet, MailStrAbr, MailCity, MailZip, MailState, Phone, Ext, Website, OpenDate, ClosedDate, Charter, CharterNum, FundingType, DOC, DOCType, SOC, SOCType, EdOpsCode, EdOpsName, EILCode, EILName, GSoffered, GSserved, Virtual, Magnet, Latitude, Longitude, AdmFName1, AdmLName1, AdmEmail1, AdmFName2, AdmLName2, AdmEmail2, AdmFName3, AdmLName3, AdmEmail3, LastUpdate
chosen: SELECT  School FROM ( SELECT T2.School, T1.AvgScrRead, RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY T2.County ORDER BY T1.AvgScrRead DESC) AS rnk FROM satscores AS T1 INNER JOIN schools AS T2 ON T1.cds = T2.CDSCode WHERE T2.Virtual = 'F') ranked_schools WHERE rnk <= 5
rejected:
SELECT
  `T2`.`School`
FROM `satscores` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `schools` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`cds` = `T2`.`CDSCode`
WHERE
  `T2`.`Virtual` = 'Yes'
ORDER BY
  `T1`.`AvgScrRead` DESC
LIMIT 5

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
List out the account numbers of female clients who are oldest and has lowest average salary, calculate the gap between this lowest average salary with the highest average salary?
Table account column names: account_id, district_id, frequency, date
Table card column names: card_id, disp_id, type, issued
Table client column names: client_id, gender, birth_date, district_id
Table disp column names: disp_id, client_id, account_id, type
Table district column names: district_id, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, A7, A8, A9, A10, A11, A12, A13, A14, A15, A16
Table loan column names: loan_id, account_id, date, amount, duration, payments, status
Table order column names: order_id, account_id, bank_to, account_to, amount, k_symbol
Table trans column names: trans_id, account_id, date, type, operation, amount, balance, k_symbol, bank, account
chosen:
SELECT
  `T1`.`account_id`,
  (
    SELECT
      MAX(`A11`) - MIN(`A11`)
    FROM `district`
  )
FROM `account` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `district` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`district_id` = `T2`.`district_id`
INNER JOIN `disp` AS `T3`
  ON `T1`.`account_id` = `T3`.`account_id`
INNER JOIN `client` AS `T4`
  ON `T3`.`client_id` = `T4`.`client_id`
WHERE
  `T2`.`district_id` = (
    SELECT
      `district_id`
    FROM `client`
    WHERE
      `gender` = 'F'
    ORDER BY
      `birth_date` ASC
    LIMIT 1
  )
ORDER BY
  `T2`.`A11` DESC
LIMIT 1
rejected:
SELECT
  `T1`.`account_id`,
  (
    SELECT
      MAX(`T3`.`amount`) - MIN(`T3`.`amount`)
    FROM `trans` AS `T3`
    WHERE
      `T3`.`account_id` = `T1`.`account_id`
  )
FROM `client` AS `T2`
INNER JOIN `account` AS `T1`
  ON `T1`.`district_id` = `T2`.`district_id`
WHERE
  `T2`.`gender` = 'F'
ORDER BY
  `T2`.`birth_date` ASC
LIMIT 1

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
List out the account numbers of clients who are youngest and have highest average salary?
Table account column names: account_id, district_id, frequency, date
Table card column names: card_id, disp_id, type, issued
Table client column names: client_id, gender, birth_date, district_id
Table disp column names: disp_id, client_id, account_id, type
Table district column names: district_id, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, A7, A8, A9, A10, A11, A12, A13, A14, A15, A16
Table loan column names: loan_id, account_id, date, amount, duration, payments, status
Table order column names: order_id, account_id, bank_to, account_to, amount, k_symbol
Table trans column names: trans_id, account_id, date, type, operation, amount, balance, k_symbol, bank, account
chosen:
SELECT
  `T1`.`account_id`
FROM `account` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `disp` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`account_id` = `T2`.`account_id`
INNER JOIN `client` AS `T3`
  ON `T2`.`client_id` = `T3`.`client_id`
INNER JOIN `district` AS `T4`
  ON `T4`.`district_id` = `T1`.`district_id`
WHERE
  `T2`.`client_id` = (
    SELECT
      `client_id`
    FROM `client`
    ORDER BY
      `birth_date` DESC
    LIMIT 1
  )
GROUP BY
  `T4`.`A11`,
  `T1`.`account_id`
rejected:
SELECT
  `T1`.`account_id`
FROM `account` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `disp` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`account_id` = `T2`.`account_id`
INNER JOIN `client` AS `T3`
  ON `T2`.`client_id` = `T3`.`client_id`
INNER JOIN (
  SELECT
    `T2`.`account_id`,
    AVG(`T1`.`amount`) AS `avg_salary`
  FROM `trans` AS `T1`
  INNER JOIN `disp` AS `T2`
    ON `T1`.`account_id` = `T2`.`account_id`
  WHERE
    `T1`.`type` = 'VYBER'
  GROUP BY
    `T2`.`account_id`
) AS `T4`
  ON `T3`.`client_id` = `T4`.`account_id`
WHERE
  `T3`.`birth_date` = (
    SELECT
      MAX(`birth_date`)
    FROM `client`
  )
ORDER BY
  `T4`.`avg_salary` DESC
LIMIT 1

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
In the branch where the second-highest number of crimes were committed in 1995 occurred, how many male clients are there?
Table account column names: account_id, district_id, frequency, date
Table card column names: card_id, disp_id, type, issued
Table client column names: client_id, gender, birth_date, district_id
Table disp column names: disp_id, client_id, account_id, type
Table district column names: district_id, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, A7, A8, A9, A10, A11, A12, A13, A14, A15, A16
Table loan column names: loan_id, account_id, date, amount, duration, payments, status
Table order column names: order_id, account_id, bank_to, account_to, amount, k_symbol
Table trans column names: trans_id, account_id, date, type, operation, amount, balance, k_symbol, bank, account
chosen:
SELECT
  COUNT(`T1`.`client_id`)
FROM `client` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `district` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`district_id` = `T2`.`district_id`
WHERE
  `T1`.`gender` = 'M'
  AND `T2`.`A15` = (
    SELECT
      `T3`.`A15`
    FROM `district` AS `T3`
    ORDER BY
      `T3`.`A15` DESC
    LIMIT 1
    OFFSET 1
  )
rejected:
SELECT
  COUNT(`T1`.`client_id`)
FROM `client` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `district` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`district_id` = `T2`.`district_id`
WHERE
  `T1`.`gender` = 'M'
  AND `T2`.`A2` = (
    SELECT
      `T3`.`A2`
    FROM `district` AS `T3`
    INNER JOIN (
      SELECT
        `district_id`,
        SUM(`amount`) AS `total_crimes`
      FROM `crime`
      WHERE
        `date` LIKE '1995%'
      GROUP BY
        `district_id`
      ORDER BY
        `total_crimes` DESC
      LIMIT 1 OFFSET 1
    ) AS `T4`
      ON `T3`.`district_id` = `T4`.`district_id`
  )

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
What was the growth rate of the total amount of loans across all accounts for a male client between 1996 and 1997?
Table account column names: account_id, district_id, frequency, date
Table card column names: card_id, disp_id, type, issued
Table client column names: client_id, gender, birth_date, district_id
Table disp column names: disp_id, client_id, account_id, type
Table district column names: district_id, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, A7, A8, A9, A10, A11, A12, A13, A14, A15, A16
Table loan column names: loan_id, account_id, date, amount, duration, payments, status
Table order column names: order_id, account_id, bank_to, account_to, amount, k_symbol
Table trans column names: trans_id, account_id, date, type, operation, amount, balance, k_symbol, bank, account
chosen:
SELECT
  CAST((
    SUM(
      CASE
        WHEN DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T1`.`date` AS DATETIME), '%Y') = '1997'
        THEN `T1`.`amount`
        ELSE 0
      END
    ) - SUM(
      CASE
        WHEN DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T1`.`date` AS DATETIME), '%Y') = '1996'
        THEN `T1`.`amount`
        ELSE 0
      END
    )
  ) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / SUM(
    CASE
      WHEN DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T1`.`date` AS DATETIME), '%Y') = '1996'
      THEN `T1`.`amount`
      ELSE 0
    END
  )
FROM `loan` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `account` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`account_id` = `T2`.`account_id`
INNER JOIN `disp` AS `T3`
  ON `T3`.`account_id` = `T2`.`account_id`
INNER JOIN `client` AS `T4`
  ON `T4`.`client_id` = `T3`.`client_id`
WHERE
  `T4`.`gender` = 'M' AND `T3`.`type` = 'OWNER'
rejected:
SELECT
  (
    SUM(
      CASE
        WHEN SUBSTR(`T2`.`date`, 1, 4) = '1997'
        THEN `T2`.`amount`
        ELSE 0
      END
    ) - SUM(
      CASE
        WHEN SUBSTR(`T2`.`date`, 1, 4) = '1996'
        THEN `T2`.`amount`
        ELSE 0
      END
    )
  ) / SUM(
    CASE
      WHEN SUBSTR(`T2`.`date`, 1, 4) = '1996'
      THEN `T2`.`amount`
      ELSE 0
    END
  )
FROM `client` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `loan` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`client_id` = `T2`.`account_id`
WHERE
  `T1`.`gender` = 'M'

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
How often does account number 3 request an account statement to be released? What was the aim of debiting 3539 in total?

Table client column names: client_id, gender, birth_date, district_id
Table disp column names: disp_id, client_id, account_id, type

WHERE
  `T1`.`account_id` = 3 AND `T2`.`amount` = 3539

  AVG(`T2`.`amount`)
FROM `account` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `loan` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`account_id` = `T2`.`account_id`
WHERE
  `T2`.`status` IN ('C', 'D') AND `T1`.`frequency` = 'POPLATEK PO OBRATU'
rejected:
SELECT
  CAST(SUM(`T1`.`amount`) AS DOUBLE) / COUNT(`T1`.`loan_id`)
FROM `loan` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `trans` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`account_id` = `T2`.`account_id`
WHERE
  `T1`.`status` = 'C' AND `T2`.`date` > `T1`.`date`

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
Provide the IDs and age of the client with high level credit card, which is eligible for loans.
Table account column names: account_id, district_id, frequency, date
Table card column names: card_id, disp_id, type, issued
Table client column names: client_id, gender, birth_date, district_id
Table disp column names: disp_id, client_id, account_id, type
Table district column names: district_id, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, A7, A8, A9, A10, A11, A12, A13, A14, A15, A16
Table loan column names: loan_id, account_id, date, amount, duration, payments, status
Table order column names: order_id, account_id, bank_to, account_to, amount, k_symbol
Table trans column names: trans_id, account_id, date, type, operation, amount, balance, k_symbol, bank, account
chosen:
SELECT
  `T1`.`client_id`,
  DATE_FORMAT(CAST(CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AS DATETIME), '%Y') - DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T3`.`birth_date` AS DATETIME), '%Y')
FROM `disp` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `card` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`disp_id` = `T1`.`disp_id`
INNER JOIN `client` AS `T3`
  ON `T1`.`client_id` = `T3`.`client_id`
WHERE
  `T2`.`type` = 'gold' AND `T1`.`type` = 'OWNER'
rejected:
SELECT
  `T1`.`client_id`,
  DATE_FORMAT(CAST(CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AS DATETIME), '%Y') - DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T2`.`birth_date` AS DATETIME), '%Y')
FROM `client` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `card` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`client_id` = `T2`.`disp_id`
WHERE
  `T2`.`type` = 'Gold' AND `T2`.`issued` > '2010-01-01'

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
For accounts in 1993 with statement issued after transaction, list the account ID, district name and district region.
Table account column names: account_id, district_id, frequency, date
Table card column names: card_id, disp_id, type, issued
Table client column names: client_id, gender, birth_date, district_id
Table disp column names: disp_id, client_id, account_id, type
Table district column names: district_id, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, A7, A8, A9, A10, A11, A12, A13, A14, A15, A16
Table loan column names: loan_id, account_id, date, amount, duration, payments, status
Table order column names: order_id, account_id, bank_to, account_to, amount, k_symbol
Table trans column names: trans_id, account_id, date, type, operation, amount, balance, k_symbol, bank, account
chosen: SELECT T1.account_id, T2.A2, T2.A3 FROM account AS T1 INNER JOIN district AS T2 ON T1.district_id = T2.district_id WHERE T1.frequency = 'POPLATEK PO OBRATU' AND YEAR(T1.date) = 1993
rejected:
SELECT
  `T1`.`account_id`,
  `T2`.`A2`,
  `T2`.`A3`
FROM `account` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `district` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`district_id` = `T2`.`district_id`
WHERE
  SUBSTR(`T1`.`date`, 1, 4) = '1993' AND NOT EXISTS (
    SELECT
      1
    FROM `trans` AS `T3`
    WHERE
      `T3`.`account_id` = `T1`.`account_id` AND `T3`.`date` > `T1`.`date`
  )

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
From Year 1995 to 2000, who are the accounts holders from 'east Bohemia'. State the account ID the frequency of statement issuance.
Table account column names: account_id, district_id, frequency, date
Table card column names: card_id, disp_id, type, issued
Table client column names: client_id, gender, birth_date, district_id
Table disp column names: disp_id, client_id, account_id, type
Table district column names: district_id, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, A7, A8, A9, A10, A11, A12, A13, A14, A15, A16
Table loan column names: loan_id, account_id, date, amount, duration, payments, status
Table order column names: order_id, account_id, bank_to, account_to, amount, k_symbol
Table trans column names: trans_id, account_id, date, type, operation, amount, balance, k_symbol, bank, account
chosen: SELECT T1.account_id, T1.frequency FROM account AS T1 INNER JOIN district AS T2 ON T1.district_id = T2.district_id WHERE T2.A3 = 'east Bohemia' AND YEAR(T1.date) BETWEEN 1995 AND 2000
rejected:
SELECT
  `T2`.`account_id`,
  `T2`.`frequency`
FROM `district` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `account` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`district_id` = `T2`.`district_id`
WHERE
  `T1`.`A3` = 'east Bohemia'
  AND DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T2`.`date` AS DATETIME), '%Y') BETWEEN '1995' AND '2000'
